feed.title: Google Cloud: Dataform
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dataform

entry.content: Dataform now automatically selects a processing location based on the datasets referenced in your SQL queries. This makes setting the default location optional in your workflow configurations. For more information, see About repository settings. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataform now automatically selects a processing location based on the datasets referenced in your SQL queries, making the default location optional in your workflow configurations. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform automatically selects processing location

entry.content: A security vulnerability was discovered in the Dataform API. This vulnerability could potentially allow unauthorized access to customer code repositories and data. For more information, see GCP-2025-045 security bulletin.
entry.title: Security: Dataform API Vulnerability

entry.content: Updates to the automatic cataloging of Dataform metadata in Dataplex improve the near real-time management and search capabilities for repository metadata. These features are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataplex now offers improved near real-time management and search for Dataform repository metadata, with features now generally available. This update enhances how users interact with and find information within their data catalogs.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform Metadata Management in Dataplex Updated

entry.content: Dark theme is now available for BigQuery and Dataform. To turn on the dark theme, go to the Console, open the Settings and utilities menu next to your avatar, and select Preferences. On the User preferences page, select Appearance in the navigation, select your color theme, and save your selection.
entry.summary: You can now enable dark theme for BigQuery and Dataform. Access this feature through the User Preferences page under Appearance settings in the Console.
entry.title: Announcement: Dark Theme Now Available for BigQuery and Dataform

entry.content: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines, the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations, and the creation of workflow configurations. For more information, see Schedule runs. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: You can now use your Google Account credentials to authorize pipeline creation, scheduling, and execution, as well as notebook scheduling and data preparation. Workflow configurations can also be created using these credentials. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Use Google Account Credentials for Authorization

entry.content: You can now use strict act-as mode to enable an additional security check for certain user actions in Dataform. For more information, see Use strict act-as mode. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Dataform now supports strict act-as mode, an enhanced security feature for user actions. This preview feature adds an extra layer of verification for specific operations.
entry.title: Feature: New security feature in Dataform
